content.rendered:
Experience our

Billiards

About
Billiards, Snooker, Pool & 9 Ball games

Billiards, pool, snooker, & 9 ball games appear to be very similar but they are vary based on the number of balls, table size, pockets, cue stick size, & various other factors.

Features

Previous
Next

Billiards

In this, only 3 balls are used whose colors are yellow, white, & red. The yellow & white balls can be used as cue balls. It is played either between two individuals or two teams. The players have to string in order to decide who will begin the match. The points are awarded through the winning hazard, cannon, and losing hazard.
  • In cannon: the cue ball is hit in order to hit the other cue ball & then the red ball 2 points will be obtained.
  • In winning hazard: a player has to pot the red ball and in this case, 3 points are obtained.
  • In losing hazard: a player can score in the conditions such as:
  • If an individual hits another cue ball which hits the red ball and pot it 3 points will be scored.
  • If the red ball is hit first and then the other cue ball, then 2 points are scored.
  • If the other cue ball is hit and then the red ball and the red ball is not potted, 2 points are scored.
  • If the red and the other cue ball hit at the same time, then 2 points are scored.

Snooker

In this, 22 balls are used which comprises 1 cue ball, 15 red balls. It has one ball each of yellow, brown, blue, pink, black and green colors along with the table. A player has to pot one red ball and one colored ball. The winner is decided based on the number of points. A player will score 1 point by potting the red ball. Then he has to shoot the colored ball from the least valued ball to the most valued ball. The player has to shoot the least valued ball 1st & then move to the next valued ball.

Pool

Pool has different forms & based on that numbers of balls are declared. In eight-ball pool, there are 15 balls & in nine-ball pool, there are nine balls and in three-ball pool, there are three balls. After the first shot, the players have to select whether to play with solid colored balls or striped colored balls. After potting any of the seven balls, the 8 ball has to be potted. An individual can win if:
  • He pots the 8 ball legally after potting all the seven balls.
  • The opponent illegally pots the 8 ball.
  • 8 ball is knocked off the table.

9 Ball

It is a rotation game wherein players try to shoot at the lowest number on the table. Balls do not require to be pocketed in numerical order but the cue ball must strike the lowest numbered ball on the table 1st Nine Ball is played with nine object balls numbered one through nine and a cue ball. On each shot the first ball the cue ball contacts must be the lowest-numbered ball on the table, but the balls need not be pocketed in order. If a player pockets any ball on a legal shot, he remains at the table for another shot, and continues until he misses, fouls, or wins the game by pocketing the 9-ball.

Features, Amenities & Benefits

The carpeted and air-conditioned room at Kings Club Billiards has top-class billiards tables and comfortable seating for those who would love to cheer the game on. A lot of people love playing billiards, as it is an excellent way to improve your own skill, or simply pass the time with friends. Playing billiards, snooker, & pool has some health benefits such as:
  • Burn Calories: In these games, the average player is going to easily walk about one mile in just one game of billiards.
  • Builds Focus: Everything you do around the pool table needs a fair amount of serious attention. Playing billiards regularly can assist you to build those kinds of skills which can be extremely useful when you’re away from the table too.
  • Improves Critical Thinking Skills: These games assist you to improve your critical thinking skills at the table and in life. Figuring a difficult bank shot or learning to slice your cue ball just right needs logical & step-by-step thinking
  • Billiards slows aging in men: Playing pool with friends assists older men to remain active as it’s a sign of healthy socializing and it also resists the process of aging as elderly pool players still require to utilize their muscles.
  • Improves stretching, balancing power: When you play pool, you require stretching more, requiring bending across the table top for reaching the cue ball at the desired angle, & more when complex shots are required. Sometimes, you require standing on one foot which improves your stability.
  • Sharpens your mind: Regular billiards and pool players often have sharper minds, as the game needs mental mathematical calculations and estimates to be done like basic physics and geometry while playing.
  • Provides fun for all, regardless of age: Playing snooker, pool and billiards is often a family affair, as they can be played by anyone, regardless of their sex or age.

Member Benefits

Types of Tables We have

Kings Club Billiards have English & small table where varied age groups can enjoy their game. It has adequate illumination. The Billiards Room is designed according to the International Standard with ample seating arrangements.

English Table

Small Table

Testimonials

Good place for snooker. Boards are other equipment's are well maintained.

Sudeendra

I visit this place very often, in fact every week with my friends to play snooker

Pradeep B V

I felt happy playing here because i found food facilities .. Loved it

Arun Prabhakar

About Certified Billiards Trainer

CHECKOUT ABOUT OUR TRAINER
Jaysheelan

Our Trainer has played billiards and devised inventions as well as new games over several years. He will show you techniques and strategy for playing billiards, snooker, & pool. You will learn a way to get a better feel for the hit of the ball, and to adjust for the humidity and speed of the cloth. His teaching is structured, facilitated with scientific explanation and demonstration. His methods for coaching billiards, snooker, & pool’s technique provide the most consistent results in a game of very small margins of error. You will be gently encouraged to strengthen your learning, practicing and teaching skills in a supportive environment.

FAQ’s About Billiards, Snooker & Pool

1. How do I become a professional player?
Kings Club runs each year and gives all-comers the chance to qualify for the professional tour. It is essential to keep an eye on our website for details of how to enter.
2. I want some coaching to improve my game, how do I find the right coach?
Kings Club has trained & experienced coaches that enable you to improve playing billiards, snooker, & pool. They will guide you regarding each detail of billiards, snooker, & pool games.
3. I’m interested in sponsoring a tournament, how do I find out more?
You can contact us for full sponsorship information.
